Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style or Mature Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior completely worn; exterior: painted decoration consisting of undetermined motif with added red; rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The number 836 is written in pencil on the itnerior surface of the sherd. The interior surface is completely worn therefore it is impossible to know whether or not there was any interior decoration. Filling ornaments are most frequently found on Wild Goat Style and Mature Animal Style vases. The rosette on the exterior surface is most commonly found in the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0356) (phase 2)
